title: pandas 1.0.1 error w/base code in `extract_outlier_frames` [ Dataframe.ix] ix removed

labels.name: Another package code issue
labels.description: Bug/issue that relates to a dlc dependency

body:
**Describe the error**

Using the latest `pandas` (version) `1.0.1`  we get an error with extract_outliers (note, all other functions pass the testscript.py test). 

```
EXTRACT OUTLIERS
Method  jump  found  11  putative outlier frames.
Do you want to proceed with extracting  5  of those?
If this list is very large, perhaps consider changing the paramters (start, stop, epsilon, comparisonbodyparts) or use a different method.
Loading video...
Duration of video [s]:  0.4 , recorded @  30.0 fps!
Overall # of frames:  12 with (cropped) frame dimensions:
Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0  seconds to 0.4  seconds.
Extracting and downsampling... 11  frames from the video.
11it [00:00, 220.14it/s]
Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while)
Let's select frames indices: [11, 3, 1, 9, 5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "testscript.py", line 126, in <module>
    deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(path_config_file,[newvideo],outlieralgorithm='jump',epsilon=0,automatic=True, destfolder=dfolder)
  File "C:\Users\Mathis_Lab_3\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frames.py", line 191, in extract_outlier_frames
    ExtractFramesbasedonPreselection(Indices,extractionalgorithm,Dataframe,dataname,scorer,video,cfg,config,opencv,cluster_resizewidth,cluster_color,savelabeled)
  File "C:\Users\Mathis_Lab_3\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frames.py", line 368, in ExtractFramesbasedonPreselection
    DF = Dataframe.ix[frames2pick]
  File "C:\Users\Mathis_Lab_3\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\generic.py", line 5274, in __getattr__
    return object.__getattribute__(self, name)
AttributeError: 'DataFrame' object has no attribute 'ix'
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. install latest DLC from pypi/repo; Go to 'examples'
2. run `python testscript.py`
4. See error (posted above)

**Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - DeepLabCut Version 2.1.6.2
 
**Additional context**
Roll back to pre 1.0 `pandas`, i.e. `pandas==0.25.3` fixes the error. 
Suggest pinning pandas in `setup.py` and/or fixing code to cope with removed function.
i.e. modify: 
```
\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frames.py", line 368, in ExtractFramesbasedonPreselection
    DF = Dataframe.ix[frames2pick]
```

Full log is here: 
[testscript.py fail.txt](https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/files/4271200/testscript.py.fail.txt)
